titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Peace and Social Justice Program (PSJ), Human Rights and International Cooperation (HRIC), Office Files of Mahnaz lspahani
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Peace and Social Justice Program (PSJ), Human Rights and International Cooperation (HRIC), Office Files of Mahnaz lspahani FA597

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-12-16 03:16:57 -0500.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Peace and Social Justice Program (PSJ), Human Rights and International Cooperation (HRIC), Office Files of Mahnaz lspahani

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records are open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in 9 series by file type.
Series V. ICT Scholar in Residence, 1998-2001

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, liason grants, board of trustees materials, consultants files, ICT Scholar-In-Residence materials, meeting records, organization files, regional files and subject files.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Mahnaz Ispahani Bartos is a foreign policy expert, jewelry dealer, former foundation executive, and author who worked for ten years at the Ford Foundation. She joined the Foundation as a Program Officer in the International Affairs Program in 1992 and later became Deputy Director of the Peace and Social Justice Program (PSJ) Human Rights and International Cooperation unit (HRIC).

In addition to her work at the Ford Foundation, Ispahani worked as a senior fellow for South Asia at the Council on Foreign Relations where she directed the Roundtable on South Asia and U.S. Policy. She had other fellowships at the Harvard University Belfer Center and the Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars at the Smithsonian Institution. She has also been an advisor to the Carnegie Corporation and the Open Society Institute. In 2013, she started her business, the Mahnaz Collection which is a jewelry gallery in New York City.

Ispahani was born in East Pakistan (present day Bangladesh). Her family owns and manages the Ispahani Group, a Bangladeshi conglomerate. Her grandfather Mirza Abul Hassan Isaphani served as Pakistan's first ambassador to the United States. Mahnaz Ispahani is married to photographer Adam Bartos.

Ispahani earned a B.A. in English literature and political science from Wellesley College and a Ph.D. and Master of Arts in Law and Diplomacy from the Tufts University Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy.
